III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10177 Resident restraint.
Section (1) The facility shall establish and follow written policy and
Description procedures specifying the use of resident restraint.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was allegedly improperly restrained and experienced
injuries as a result.
Investigation The complainant was interviewed on 02/14/2023 and did not
have any further information to provide.
1

Youth A was interviewed over video on 02/15/2023. Since the
incident in question occurred on 02/09/2023 his placement had
changed to the Saginaw County Jail. Youth A stated that he feels
he gets more respect from staff at the jail than at his previous
placement and singled out Staff 1 as a main source of that
disrespect. Youth A recalled the incident in question. He stated
that he was participating in a group session with the rest of his unit
when Staff 4 came in to join. Youth A stated that he thought they
were finished, and he remembered Staff 4 stating that they
needed to continue. Youth A recalled Staff 1 saying something to
the effect of “Go ahead and snitch” regarding rules in the program
about youth holding each other accountable. Youth A stated that
this upset him, and he voiced that, and Staff 1 asked him to have
a Behavior Management Timeout, which upset him more. Youth
A stated that he wanted to fight Staff 1 at that point in time
because he was tired of being treated that way and admitted to
picking up a chair and throwing it at Staff 1 and then attempting to
hit him. Youth A stated that the next thing he knew was that he
was on the floor with several staff surrounding him. He stated that
he believed Staff 2 took him to the floor. Youth A stated that he
was on the floor on his stomach in a prone position with one arm
underneath him at that point. He recalled Staff 2 having his hands
on him and telling him to breathe and calm down. Youth A stated
that this helped, and he was able to be calm and get up with Staff
2 once he knew that was who was with him and that Staff 1 was
not in the room anymore. Youth A stated that he had a few
scratches as a result of the incident but no further injuries in his
opinion. Youth A stated that he was offered to see the nurse after
the restraint but declined.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 during an
announced face-to-face visit to the facility on 02/22/2023. She
stated that she got called into the unit and witnessed the incident
in question. When she came into the unit, she witnessed Youth A
standing up and cussing and getting more agitated. She stated
that she and Staff 3 started to move other youth into their rooms
as it is standard practice at the facility. This is done in order to
reduce the number of witnesses or other youth that could get
involved in an incident as it is escalating. She stated that all of the
youth were compliant in this situation. Supervisor 1 recalled that
as this was occurring, she turned around and saw Youth A pick up
a chair and throw it at Staff 1. Supervisor 1 stated that Youth A
then charged at Staff 1 and very quickly ended up on the ground
near the rear wall of the unit. Supervisor 1 described this
sequence of events as Youth A charging Staff 1 and attempting to
hit him, and then both Youth A and Staff 1 falling backwards
2

towards the wall. Supervisor 1 recalled that Staff 2 was able to
physically restrain Youth A. She stated that she asked Staff 1 to
leave the unit in order to remove the person that the youth was so
focused on and possibly triggered by, and Staff 1 did so.
Supervisor 1 recalled that, at this point in time, Staff 2 was nearest
to Youth A and Supervisor 1 already saw Youth A start to calm
down. Supervisor 1 remembered Staff 2 asking Youth A to get up
and Youth A did so voluntarily, and they walked Youth A to his
room. Supervisor 1 stated that the incident ended at that point and
there were no visible injuries to Youth A. She stated that she
participated in checking on Youth A in the variable 15-minute
requirements as Youth A was in his room and secluded after the
incident. At this point in time, Youth A was still rotating between
being calm and being escalated. Supervisor 1 recalled offering
Youth A over the counter medication if he had any physical pain
as a result of the restraint and he refused this.
Staff 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 during an
announced face-to-face visit to the facility on 02/22/2023. He
stated he recalled the incident in question with Youth A. Staff 1
stated that he was involved from the beginning to the point in time
when Supervisor 1 asked him to leave the incident. Staff 1 stated
that the unit was having a group session with Staff 4 as this
occurs several times per week. Staff 1 recalled that Youth A was
agitated, and he believed he was mad at Staff 1 because Staff 1
had provided some feedback to the group earlier about
inappropriate use of their “checking system” where youth are
required to hold each other accountable. Staff 1 recalled that
Youth A was talking to Staff 4 about who instructed the group to
stop with the “checking” and Staff 1 made a choice to speak up
and state that he had in order to provide clarity to the
conversation. Staff 1 recalled that Youth A stated something to the
effect of “don’t call me a snitch” at that moment, but Staff 1 denied
ever stating that word or calling Youth A that himself. He also
remembered that no one else in the room ever used that word.
Staff 1 recalled that Youth A continued to escalate verbally and
that in response Staff 1 made the choice to call a behavior
management time out. Staff 2 and Staff 3 were called to the unit
and started to escort the rest of the unit to their rooms. As this
occurred Staff 1 turned around from a separate youth’s doorway
to see Youth A pick up a chair and throw it at him. Staff 1 stated
that he was able to deflect the chair coming at him only to see
Youth A rush him and start to throw punches. Staff 1 recalled that
the other staff in the room immediately came to his assistance as
Youth A essentially tackled him into the wall. Staff 1 named
Supervisor 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 as the other staff in the room at
3

that moment. As Youth A rushed forward, Staff 1 recalled that he
was only able to grab Youth A’s hands to stop Youth A’s attempts
to punch him, but no other restraint methods were able to be used
in that quick timeframe. Staff 1 stated that Youth A quickly ended
up on the ground with Staff 2 having the most immediate physical
contact with him. Staff 1 clarified that Staff 2 assisted him in
placing Youth A on the ground and Staff 2 physically restrained
the youth. At that point Supervisor 1 asked Staff 1 to leave the
unit in order to help de-escalate the situation. Staff 1 stated that at
that point he left the unit and proceeded to start working with a
different unit and helping them go through their shower process.
Staff 1 stated that he eventually did make it back to Youth A’s unit
and heard Youth A yelling at him from his room. Staff 1 stated that
he never heard Youth A complain about any pain in any form.
Staff 1 stated that he was in this unit a couple more times before
his shift ended, but was never alone with Youth A after the
incident. Staff 1 stated that he did not recall ever having any
issues with Youth A prior to this incident but that he did remember
hearing Youth A talk about wanting to make it to the county jail
because he did not feel it was appropriate for him to be placed at
the juvenile facility. Staff 1 stated that he brought this up because
he felt like this might have been a motivating factor for the incident
escalating so quickly.
Staff 2 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 during an
announced face-to-face visit to the facility on 02/22/2023. He
stated that he was involved in the incident in question. His
involvement began with being called on the radio in the request
coming through to come to Youth A‘s unit. Staff 2 stated that when
he came into the unit he essentially walked right in and saw Youth
A pick up a chair and throw it at Staff 1. He then saw Youth A rush
at Staff 1 and start to throw punches, and both of the individuals
fell into the wall as a result. Staff 2 stated that he was able to get
to both, Youth A had fallen to the ground. Staff 2 stated that he
was able to get his own hands-on Youth A’s wrists to perform a
floor restraint and attempt to de-escalate Youth A. Staff 2 stated
he started speaking to Youth A to tell him that Staff 1 was gone
and identify himself. Staff 2 stated that he had felt like he had a
good relationship with Youth A and thought he could help de-
escalate him at that moment. Staff 2 stated that he heard Youth A
talking the entire time they were on the ground, which was about a
minute or so. Youth A stated “I’m going to county” over and over.
Staff 2 stated that he then asked Youth A if he was ready to get up
and be safe and Youth A confirmed this. Staff 2 recalled that
Youth A got up voluntarily and walked to his room. Staff 2 saw
Youth A in his room a short time afterwards and recalled that
4

Youth A was at times getting more upset over the incident but
that, when asked about why the incident occurred, Youth A didn’t
want to talk about it.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 during an
announced face-to-face visit to the facility on 02/22/2023. He
stated that he was not involved with the incident, but he did
provide follow up work with Youth A after the restraint in order to
ensure proper medical care. Supervisor 2 stated that Youth A was
uncooperative for the nurse the next day. Supervisor 2 supervised
Youth A for a shower the morning after the incident and all he
really recalled Youth A saying was that he “wanted to go to
county.” Supervisor 2 stated that he asked on multiple occasions
if Youth A was feeling okay or if there were any injuries from the
incident, and Youth A never stated that there were. At the end of
the shower Youth A was asked by Supervisor 2 if he wanted to
see the nurse again and Youth A declined.
Staff 3 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 during an
announced face-to-face visit to the facility on 02/22/2023. He
stated that he had participated in the incident and that he was
called to the unit as it was beginning. He stated that he walked in
with Staff 2 and saw Youth A pick up the chair to throw at Staff 1.
Staff 3 stated that he next saw Youth A rush Staff 1 and throw
punches at him. Staff 3 stated that he did not participate in the
restraint, but he helped ensure that the other youth in the unit did
not escalate themselves as it was occurring. Staff 3 stated that he
did not see anything of concern during the restraint that was
performed by Staff 2 of Youth A and that he did not believe that
Youth A was slammed to the ground, but that Youth A‘s own
momentum from charging at Staff 1 is what caused him to fall to
the ground. Staff 3 stated that he did not believe the restraint
occurred for more than a minute, and that the only time staff had
their hands on Youth A was Staff 1 blocking punches being thrown
at him and then Staff 2 helping lift Youth A up when he had
calmed down. He stated that he never heard anyone use the word
snitch during the entire interaction.
Youth B was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 during an
announced face-to-face visit to the facility on 02/22/2023. He
stated that he was in Youth A’s unit at the time that this incident
occurred and saw the entire incident unfold. Youth B stated that
he knew Youth A was upset off and on the entire day and that he
had heard Youth A state several times prior that he did not believe
he should be there and wanted to go to the county jail for
placement. Youth B stated that he was in the group conversation
5

that is run by Staff 4 when Youth A got more upset. Youth B
stated that he was asked to go to his room and did so voluntarily
when Youth A threw the chair at Staff 1. He stated that he did not
see this but did see Youth A rush Staff 1 and throw punches at
him. Youth B stated that he did not get a good view of the restraint
because there were several other people in the way, but he did
state that the entire incident did not last more than a minute or two
and he saw Youth A get up on his own and go to his room. Youth
B stated that he never heard anyone use the word snitch other
than Youth A accusing Staff 1 of calling him that during the
interaction.
Youth C was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 during an
announced face-to-face visit to the facility on 02/22/2023. He
stated that he was in a unit placed with Youth A when the incident
occurred. He recalled that the unit was doing their group session
with Staff 4 as Youth A began to escalate. Youth C stated that he
did not recall the word snitch being used by anyone, but he did
remember Staff 1 saying something to the effect of “do the right
thing” to Youth A as Youth A got more upset. Youth C stated that
he has seen Youth A get escalated in past incidents very quickly
just as occurred in this incident. Youth C stated that he was
walking to his room as requested by staff. Youth A threw a chair
at Staff 1, which Youth C was not able to fully see. Youth C stated
that it is facility rules that youth are supposed to avert their eyes
and follow staff directives when there is an escalating incident
such as this. Youth C stated that he did not see the full restraint,
but he was able to state that the entire incident started and ended
very quickly and that he did see Youth A walking to his room on
his own accord at the end of it.
Staff 4 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1
during an announced face-to-face visit to the facility on
02/22/2023. She stated that she is a therapist who runs group
sessions at the facility. Staff 4 recalled that she was running the
group session for Youth A’s unit on the day of the incident. She
recalled that Youth A was getting emotional about the group rules
and accountability between the youth in the unit when it appeared
that Youth A unnecessarily turned his anger towards Staff 1 after
being properly redirected. Staff 4 stated that Youth A began to
refuse Staff 1’s directives and quickly escalated. She recalled that
he took off his shirt and then picked up a chair and threw it at Staff
1. Staff 4 stated that Youth A then rushed Staff 1 and they both
quickly fell to the floor near the wall of the unit. She stated that she
could not remember exactly who was on the floor with Youth A at
that point. Staff 4 did recall that Staff 1 left the unit and Staff 2
6

took over attempting to communicate with Youth A and was able
to get Youth A to stand up and walk him to his room. Staff 4 stated
that she never heard the word snitch from anyone, other than
Youth A accusing Staff 1 of calling him that. Staff 4 stated that she
was not involved with Youth A in the immediate aftermath of the
restraint.
Documents reviewed:
Video recording of the unit that contained the incident occurred on
02/09/2023. There was no audio available for the video. The
video is approximately three minutes and fifteen seconds long. In
the video it can be seen that the unit including Youth A was
participating in a group session run by Staff 4. At the 0:30 mark
Youth A appears to begin to escalate and Staff 1 can be seen
attempting to ask other youth to move towards their rooms. As
Youth A escalates further, he takes off his pants and sweatshirt
and moves more around the unit as other youth go to their rooms.
Staff 1 has a calm physical demeanor during this part of the video.
At the 1:10 mark Youth A picks up a chair and throws it at Staff 1
and then immediately rushes him. When Youth A gets to Staff 1,
he begins to throw punches at him and Staff 1 appears to protect
himself and catches Youth A’s wrists. Staff 1 falls backwards
towards the back wall of the unit, continuing with the momentum
of Youth A coming at him. Staff 1 continued to hold on to Youth
A’s wrists as they both fall to the ground, with Youth A falling to his
back and Staff 1 falling forward over the top of him. At no point in
the video is there evidence that Youth A was slammed to the
ground, nor does Staff 1 fall directly on top of Youth A. Youth A
continued to attempt to punch Staff 1 in the head or upper body as
Supervisor 1 and Staff 2 came to them. As they fall to the ground,
Supervisor 1 and Staff 2 intervene by using their hands to pull
Youth A and Staff 1 apart. It should be noted that Youth A
continued to struggle and attempt to hit Staff 1 until he was laid
down face first on the ground by Staff 2 at the 1:30 mark of the
video. This was not done in an aggressive manner. At this point
Staff 1 was able to separate himself from Youth A and walked
away. While Staff 2 is on the ground holding Youth A, Supervisor
1 is standing next to them with her hand on Staff 1’s shoulder.
From this point in the video to the 2:55 mark Staff 2 had his hands
on Youth A’s shoulders and was performing a floor restraint on the
ground, which was consistent with interviews with both Youth A
and various staff who were involved in the incident. Youth A
eventually got up under his own power and walked to his room
with Staff 2.
• Personnel documentation for Staff 1, Staff 4 and Staff 5
was reviewed, and none had any discipline of concern in
7

their employment with the facility. All three staff were
current with their CPI restraint training.
• Physical Force policy from the facility. This states that
“staff are never to use more physical force than is
necessary to control a situation” and that physical force
may be deemed necessary in circumstances where staff
are acting in self-defense.
• Incident reports dated 02/09/2023 from the facility authored
by Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4 and Supervisor 1. It was
confirmed that these were the only staff in the unit during
the time of the incident. All of the incident reports are
consistent and describe a similar recollection of events
where Youth A escalated and eventually threw a chair at
Staff 1 and attacked him, resulting in a physical
management that was ended by Staff 2.
• Incident report dated 02/22/2023 from the facility. This was
authored by on site nursing staff that documented attempts
to provide Youth A with medical care on 02/09/2023. At the
time of nursing staff’s attempts to provide care Youth A was
still escalated and refused their care.
Analysis Through interviews of youth and staff as well as documents
reviewed there are no violations found for this rule. There was no
evidence found of an improper restraint.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
